alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:11PM CST until January 13 at 9:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel for Some Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow moves back in this afternoon with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 35 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Visibilities may briefly fall to a 1/4 of a mile or less. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Grant County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
